posts.content: Hi guys, Just a few words to share my first 'Internet of Things', based on Jaluino Bee board (Microchip PIC based, using jalv2 language & jallib libraries). This is a simple powermeter counting W/h from a flashing LED, publishing collected data to ThingSpeak every minute. http://jaluino.org/building-a-powermeter-with-jaluino-bee Thanks to ThingSpeak guys for your great service ! Cheers,Seb
posts.author: sirloon

posts.content: Cool project. I have not used the Jaluino Bee before. I will post this up and link to the project. Thanks for posting!
posts.author: Hans

posts.content: I've just ordered a Teensy USB board: http://www.pjrc.com/teensy/ As soon as it arrives I'm going to try moving my arduino project over to that. Anyone used this sort of board before? Matt
posts.author: mattyw

posts.content: I don't have much experience with the Teensy, but I do have the Arduino Mini / Nano from Gravitech. I think all you need is the ability to read some inputs and send the data as serial via the USB cable to the computer. If so, I think Teensy might be a good option.
posts.author: Hans
